{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3148864,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-20T02:39:16.408Z","cooked":"

We’ve been using a very simple PID on the pitch, and I’m not sure its the ideal way to do it. It can cause a lot of oscillation and at times a balance feels a little lucky. We are exploring the idea of looking at a derivative of the pitch as well to better understand

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-02-20T02:39:16.408Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":82,"reads":604,"readers_count":603,"score":545.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"joemost","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3148869,"name":"Alex","username":"legoguy1000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-20T02:41:36.254Z","cooked":"

Our logic is pretty basic but i haven’t tested it yet with our actual robot, only our test mini bot. Drive “fast” until the pitch is higher than X degrees then once u come back below Y degrees slow down and stop once u are “level”. Seemed to work pretty well in testing but not perfect.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-02-20T02:41:36.254Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":606,"readers_count":605,"score":151.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor & Alumnus"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/2","custom_user_title":"Mentor & Alumnus","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3148870,"name":"Jainish Patel","username":"JaiCodes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaicodes/{size}/203987_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-20T02:41:38.018Z","cooked":"

We used a simple PID but we limit the speed. If the PID is trying to apply a speed above the limit, set the motors to the limit. If the PID is trying to apply the speed below the limit, let the PID itself control the drivetrain.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-02-20T02:41:38.018Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":606,"readers_count":605,"score":176.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"Jainish Patel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54172,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4065 NOP | Programming Lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/3","custom_user_title":"4065 NOP | Programming Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3148905,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-20T03:51:04.623Z","cooked":"

We use PID on the pitch, speed limited. But to be honest, the PID isn’t really needed and can just drive at a set speed. Once the pitch is less than 3 degrees or the rate of change of the pitch is greater than some value (I think we have 15 degrees/sec right now) turn all the modules to 45 degrees and enable brake mode. The trick is to stop driving once the charging station starts moving. If you stop once it reaches level you’ve probably already gone too far.

We’ve had a lot of success doing it this way and can frequently balance without any oscillations. It can be really simple and still work pretty well. If you want to expand on it a bit you can use the roll and pitch together so you can balance in any orientation.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-02-20T03:51:04.623Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":47,"reads":571,"readers_count":570,"score":624.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"Michael Jansen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":16}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/4","custom_user_title":"3015 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":16}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":16,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3148979,"name":"Joshua Epperson","username":"jepperson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/74df32/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-20T06:24:21.129Z","cooked":"

You need to lower your P gain. We noticed that at around 6 degrees for our robot was a good place to start balancing our PID. Aside from that what we do is we just drive in a straight line (dead reckoning) until our gyro is reporting more than 6 degrees on the pitch then we apply a p control gyro and always have that command. We also put our robot on coast initially for the drive part then we switch to brake mode on the gyro PID and have it always running and then we kill the command at teleopinit. Additionally a MAJOR factor which helped it work was clamping the PID output to 50%

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-02-20T06:26:27.569Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":515,"readers_count":514,"score":153.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"Joshua Epperson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49514,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3149005,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-20T11:49:37.156Z","cooked":"

Yeah we’ve found as soon as it swings your done!

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-02-20T11:49:37.156Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":460,"readers_count":459,"score":107.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"joemost","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33850,"username":"mjansen4857","name":"Michael Jansen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3149076,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-20T16:17:04.687Z","cooked":"

We were talking a bit about auto balancing at our meeting yesterday, and I’m curious if anyone is planning to use limelight/photonvision in combination with AprilTag data to “balance”?

Our thought is that if you can send your robot accurately to the center coordinates of the charging station (coordinates obtained via AprilTags), you should in theory end up balanced every time. This of course assumes no other robot is interacting with the charge station in auto.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-02-20T16:17:04.687Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":418,"readers_count":417,"score":83.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/7","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3149533,"name":"","username":"Autumn-Ou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/autumn-ou/{size}/192598_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T01:44:27.586Z","cooked":"

A combination of PID for angle to actually balance and then using our localization data from our April tags & Kalman filter to allow us to position our bot right to the edge of the change pad and stay there if a teammate bumps us or the charge pad tips.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T01:44:27.586Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":364,"readers_count":363,"score":77.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56369,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Making funky products"},"user_suspended":true,"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/8","custom_user_title":"Making funky products","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3149722,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T05:43:44.649Z","cooked":"
legoguy1000:

Drive “fast” until the pitch is higher than X degrees then once u come back below Y degrees slow down and stop once u are “level”.

You might want to set a limit. If a stray robot is holding the charging station tilted, you’ll drive fast right off the high side.

I think we might see a few tipped robots in the first 15-seconds this year.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T05:43:44.649Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":339,"readers_count":338,"score":82.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/9","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3149757,"name":"Alex","username":"legoguy1000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T09:55:53.899Z","cooked":"

Ya we did that a few times in practice . I need to do some more testing.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T09:55:53.899Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":305,"readers_count":304,"score":66.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor & Alumnus"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/10","custom_user_title":"Mentor & Alumnus","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3158235,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-06T16:00:11.140Z","cooked":"

Damn. Our Approach failed! The variance in the actual charging station versus the one we built out of wood got us. The team kit field ones are much tippier it seems.

This definitely is a CG/case by case basis for most teams. The tipping for us is too much of a lagging indicator. My guess is we are going to need to instead tune it to be cool with a certain amount of pitch. Rather than driving too far and letting it begin to tip.

Either that or let it tip and then drive back

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-03-06T16:00:11.140Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":261,"readers_count":260,"score":72.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"joemost","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3158269,"name":"Jacob Frye","username":"jacob6838","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/f14d63/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-06T16:27:31.407Z","cooked":"

You could try driving until it begins to tip, then driving backwards a specific (tuned) distance? Might be really fast and consistent

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-03-06T16:27:31.407Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":240,"readers_count":239,"score":68.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427432,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing","display_username":"Jacob Frye","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":20003,"username":"joemost","name":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50891,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 4499 | Drive Coach and Physicist"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/12","custom_user_title":"FRC 4499 | Drive Coach and Physicist","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3158297,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-06T16:45:47.017Z","cooked":"

I’m especially interested in seeing how robots interact when trying to level the platform with multiple robots on it.

It seems that if “everyone” (or maybe even more just more than one) try to level the platform, it’s going to get tough. I’m wondering if it makes sense to just have n-1 (“n” being the number of robots on the platform) just drive up to a roughly centered position and let only one of the robots do the balancing with the other robots stopped. In that case, an indicating mark or stripe or something on the robots that will stop showing the rough location of the CG so that you’d be able to be able to put your known CG roughly in the middle might be worthwhile.

It’s one thing to balance it by yourself - add more robots to the mix and the interactions get much tougher.

[ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-approach-to-automate-charging-station-balancing/427432/13","custom_user_title":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3158303,"name":"Jackson Hochstetler","username":"hochstetjac33","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hochstetjac33/{size}/184799_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-06T16:47:23.696Z","cooked":"

My team has an auto balance that worked in every single match we played in our week one competition (except the last one, but that’s because we accidentally unplugged the gyro). It’s definitely not the fastest, but it works every time. The robot will drive forward at a certain speed, then when it detects an pitch greater than a certain number of degrees (a number which is only reached at one point when it first gets on the charge station). After that it will continue at that speed for a certain amount of time, then slow way down and wait until the gyro reads a pitch lower than a certain number. When that happens, it will do a quick jerk back, which is just reverse for 0.1 seconds, and it’s done. Link I said, it’s very simple, very slow, but very consistent. The only problem we’ve had with it is when our gyro was accidentally unplugged, and the robot crossed over to the other side of the field, costing us a semifinals match.

[ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3158713,"name":"NewtonCrosby","username":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-06T21:31:33.369Z","cooked":"

We coded ours yesterday, haven’t tested it on an official charging station yet (we compete this week) but our approach is really simple:

Two different bang-bang controllers. One for reverse, and one for forward.
Two different speeds. One for reverse, and one for forward (reverse being 33% lighter than forward).

Our tuned set point was 10 degrees. Drive forward until the gyro gives us a reading below 10 degrees and stop the motors. If we’re tilting downward more than 10, reverse at the lesser speed.

Bob’s your uncle.

Worked with 100% accuracy with our test setup. We’re hoping that the field is as generous to us with an actual charge station.

If anyone is coming to this thread looking for help in a solution, our code is open-source. I’m happy to help if you have any questions.

As Itchyprince was saying in 7160’s thread, team 6081 just uses angle thresholds that when it has a certain angle on the Pidgeon it stops driving and X’s our wheels (no PIDS required) If you’re on swerve, it works. We have never missed a balance in auto yet.
